definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: He is going to scalp me or burn me at the stake.
sentences.chinese: 他要剥掉我的头皮或是在火刑柱上烧我。

sentences.english: An atom is stripped of all electrons by ionization.
sentences.chinese: 一个原子由于电离而被剥掉其全部电子。

sentences.english: The next day, when his body was found with his cortex pealed from his head.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，当丹纳头皮被剥掉的尸体被人发现的时候。

sentences.english: Ya gettin stripped from ya garments, boy, run ya jewels.
sentences.chinese: 你就要剥掉自己的衣服，小子，把你的珠宝留下。

sentences.english: I can peel them with my feet.
sentences.chinese: 我可以用脚把他们剥掉。

sentences.english: The child picked at the scab on his knee.
sentences.chinese: 那个孩子用指甲剥掉了伤疤。

sentences.english: He ripped away the mask of pretence which covered their activities.
sentences.chinese: 他剥掉了遮盖他们行动的假面具。

sentences.english: Mam peels our potatoes but Dad eats its skin and all.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈帮我们剥掉土豆皮，可爸爸连皮一块儿都吃了。

sentences.english: The Milky Way is the edge of this peel.
Remove some bark from the branch before burying.
sentences.chinese: 在埋进土里前剥掉树枝上的一些树皮。

sentences.english: She shucked the corn before boiling it.
sentences.chinese: 煮玉米之前她把外面的壳剥掉了。

sentences.english: She ripped off the mask of the hypocrite mercilessly.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不留情地剥掉这个伪君子的画皮。

sentences.english: They had gone to quite enough expense as it was, stripping the old parer off.
sentences.chinese: 光是剥掉旧纸一项费用已经很可观了。

sentences.english: First, peel the bananas and cut it up.
sentences.chinese: 首先，剥掉香蕉皮并把香蕉切碎。

sentences.english: He peeled the bark off that tree.
sentences.chinese: 他把那棵树的皮剥掉了。

sentences.english: The statesman shears the sheep, the politician skins them .
sentences.chinese: 政治家剪羊毛，政客则连羊皮也剥掉。

definition: to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to pull apart/to pry open with the hands
to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away
to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
